reason.tex:
%text When working with polynomials, it helps to know \underline\text{whether the given} \underline\text{polynomial is the product of smaller} \underline\text{polynomials}.
For all you know, the polynomial could be written more simply - and hence be easier to work with.
Knowing the \underline\text{following expansions} should cover you in most cases
% \begin{align} (x-a)^2 & = x^2 - 2ax + a^2 \\ (x+a)^2 &= x^2 + 2ax + a^2 \\ (x^2-a^2) &= (x-a)\cdot (x+a) \\ (x-a)^3 &= x^3 - 3ax^2 + 3a^2 x - a^3 \\ (x+a)^3 &= x^3 + 3ax^2 + 3a^2 x + a^3 \\ x^3 - a^3 &= (x-a)\cdot (x^2 + ax + a^2) \\ x^3 + a^3 &= (x+a)\cdot (x^2 - ax + a^2) \end{align}
